feed.title: SAP Community - SAP BTP, ABAP environment
feed.subtitle: SAP BTP, ABAP environment Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: How to get SAP BTP Competency after successfully creating a BTP Project.
entry.content:
Dear Team,

We have successfully created SAP BTP Project using BAS and BTP Subaccount.

We want to get the SAP BTP Competency for our project as a SAP Partner

Could anyone provide any defined process or steps to get the competency

entry.title: SAP BTP Trial Account Published Services Not Working
entry.content:
Hi All,

I have published few services in SAP BTP Trial Account, and these services are not working at all but old services are working fine.

  1. For V2 service the preview is total blank
  2. For V4 it is popping up "Could not open App. Please try again later."
  3. For Service URL it is giving error "The request has been blocked by UCON.

Please find the attached screenshot for reference.  Has anyone experienced this issue.

entry.title: RAP Error: Mapping Declared but Table Not Recognized, Plus Warning Messages
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I’m working on a RAP (ABAP RESTful Application Programming) scenario and encountering the following issues:

1. Error in Action: Even though I’ve added the proper mapping and declared the same table in my behavior definition, I still get an error on the action.

Could anyone suggest what else I should verify to resolve this issue?

2. Warnings: Alongside the above error, I’m seeing two warning messages that I don’t understand how to address. What are the common causes of such warnings, and how should they typically be resolved in RAP scenarios?

a. "A mapping for type "table" cannot be introduced in "entities."

b. "Association "_CONTRACTHDR" requires an alias. Since none was specified, "CONTRACTHDR" has been derived from the association name." (This comes on nested composition).

entry.title: What end-to-end testing tools are best for SAP BTP (BAS) applications with CDS views and SAPUI5?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am working on SAP Business Application Studio (BAS) projects deployed on SAP BTP that use CDS views as the data model and SAPUI5 for the front end.

I would like to implement end-to-end testing for these applications. I am familiar with general-purpose tools like Playwright or WebdriverIO, but I am not sure if they are the best fit when testing applications in the SAP ecosystem (especially those with CDS/OData services and SAPUI5).

  • Has anyone successfully used Playwright or WebdriverIO for BAS/SAPUI5 projects?

  • Are there recommended frameworks or libraries specifically designed for UI5 applications?

  • What are the best practices for handling such tests?

  • Any tutorials, examples, or community resources you could share?

Thanks in advance for your insights!

entry.title: Custom Entity as ABAP Cloud form data provider leading entity
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Can a ABAP RAP custom entity be used as a leading entity of a form data provider? I am working on embedded steampunk of S/4HANA Cloud 2508 version and have built a form object with a service definition where I have exposed a custom entity as a leading entity but the form object is erroring out.

I have added necessary annotations to service definition and the custom entity respectively. These annotations works for a CDS view entity but not for a custom entity or a CDS view defined using 'define view' syntax.

Does it mean that a custom entity cannot be used in form object?

@PascalBremer 

Best regards,

Sumit

entry.title: Failed to "Overwrite with Remote Topic Bindings" - S/4HANA Public Cloud and BTP ABAP
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Recently we've been integrating our S/4HANA Public Cloud and BTP ABAP with Event-Driven architecture using Direct Push-Based Integration. where Public Cloud is sending system and BTP ABAP is receiving system.

We've been successfully set everything up at the beginning with only Product Events. Now we've enhanced our event channel with Bill of Material Event and Change Master Event. In BTP ABAP everything looks fine.

However, when we try to "Overwrite with Remote Topic Bindings" in S/4 Public Cloud, it always fails and generates an ABAP runtime error.  

Does anyone have a hint, what could be the reason and how to solve it?

Many thanks in advance.

Best Regards,

Tan

entry.title: How to setup authentication in External FIORI APP for Communication User of OData in SAP Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I have created a new communication arrangement with new user for an Inbound OData Service in SAP PUBLIC CLOUD. I created destination in BTP with SAML Assertion. I created fiori app and deployed on to ABAP CLOUD. Everything is fine. The challenge is end user is already logged into PUBLIC CLOUD and when trying t open app for the first time before loading fiori app Communication User credentials popup is coming. In production there might be N no. of users who use this app. We are struck at a point how to make this authentication happens automatically using End User Credentials or how to setup a streamline for this authentication so that only Cloud Login is enough to load Application automatically. Everything is need to be done in SAP PUBLIC CLOUD not in on-premise.

 

SAP BTP cockpit SAP BTP Security SAP Fiori Cloud

entry.title: BTP ABAP Environment - Update Where-Used List
entry.content:
Dear Cloud-ers,

do You know how-to update the where-used-list on BTP ABAP Environment for standard repository objects ?
I did not find any alternative to saprseub report. Activation of standard objects is also not possible, which would implicitly update the where-used index.
So far using the ABAP Code Search plugin by DevEpos as an alternative, but I do not want to scan and wait a full scan for each time I am looking for something.

It is a BTP ABAP Free Tier Environment.

Thank You

Attila

entry.title: Need help in implementing "Multiple value selection" into "Value Help CDS view"
entry.content:
Hello Team,

I have requirement in SAP Public Cloud as follows –

I have implemented one CDS view Z_I_MATDOC_VH for value help for the standard field in which I’m fetching data from standard CDS view I_MaterialDocumentHeader_2. I have implemented necessary annotations in this custom CDS view.

There is another CDS  view Z_I_SELCTION for input selection. It has got 3 fields as follows –

-CompanyCode

-MaterialDocument

-MaterialDocumentYear

I’m using CDS view Z_I_MATDOC_VH into annotation -@Consumption.valueHelpDefinition : [{ entity: { name: ‘Z_I_MATDOC_VH’,

Element: ‘MaterialDocument’}}]

I’m also using annotation - @Consumption.filter.multipleSelection: true

The system is giving proper value help for field ‘MaterialDocument’.

But I’m able to select only one value from it.

My requirement is to select Multiple Values from the entries of Value Help.
Please help me with your suggestions and code snippets.

entry.title: how to start learning SAP - trainings, courses
entry.content:
Hi everybody, 

I’m new here and I have a question. I want to learn SAP and am new to this technology. Yes, I know it’s pretty tough with a lot to learn. But I want to do it because I want to change my profile. My background is data warehouse development, data modeling, and ETL development. Here I want to pivot instead of diving deeper into AWS or Azure cloud; I want to learn SAP, maybe SAP BTP and Cloud.

What do you think? Are these good topics for the future and with my background? Is there anyone here who can offer advice on which courses and trainings to start with for an introduction?

entry.title: Login Failure to SAP BTP - ABAP Environment
entry.content:
I am writing to ask for assistance because I am unable to connect to the ABAP Environment via ADT, which had been working fine until yesterday.

As usual, I expanded my project and navigated to the "Logon to the Service Instance" page, then clicked the "Open Logon Page in Browser" button to procee with login.

After entering my SAP BTP account credentials, the login process appeared to complete successfully. However, the authentication did not go through, and instead a Basic Authorization popup appeared, requesting a username and password.

I do not know which credentials are required for this popup, and I was able to use the system without any issues up until September 29. 

Finally, When I click the 'cancle' button, then page redirect to 401 error page...

 

Could you please advise me on how this issue can be resolved?

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards.

entry.title: SAP BTP CI CD service for on premise S4 HANA systems RICEFW applications
entry.content:
Hi,

Can we use SAP BTP CI CD service for premise S4 HANA systems RICEFW applications deployment? There are only 4 pre-configured pipelines (Cloud Foundry Environment, SAP Fiori for ABAP Platform, SAP Integration Suite Artifacts, Kyma Runtime )available in CI CD service.  Which pipeline to use for this on premise scenario?

Example scenario :

On premise ABAP objects development like ABAP programs written in SE38, data dictionary objects created in SE11, enhancements, smartforms, webservices etc are developed in on-premise SAP S4 HANA development system. The transport request numbers are released and are pushed to Github repository via gCTS fiori app as commits.  SAP BTP CI CD pipeline job should trigger and perform the automated testing and deployment to target on premise systems(not the subaccounts but to on premise target systems like QA and production).

How to design this on-premise scenario with SAP BTP CI CD pipeline? How to automate and configure ATC checks, unit tests, integration testing, end to end testing?

Can anybody please provide inputs?

Regards,

Sunil

entry.title: Abap Trial rap100 exercise worked the first time but I now receive Service group not published error
entry.content:
After following the RAP100 Travel tutorial successfully, I thought I would then try a variant of it in a new Package in my TRL_EN Abap trial environment. Every time I publish my Service Binding, I can see it says 'successful' in the Display publishing proceses Fiori tile, but when I click on the preview button, the apps starts to open and terminates with 'please try later'. Dev Tools show the following message trying to open the metadata : Service group 'ZRAP100_UI_TRAVEL_O4_907' not published. without being able to access //IWFND/V4_ADMIN I'm not sure what I can do. 

Am I only allowed one Package or App with a Trial account ?

Any help much appreciated.

thanks

Neil

entry.title: Custom Code Migration App - Project creation error
entry.content:
Hello,

We have configured custom code migration app in our BTP based on guided procedure. We are getting below error while creating project

Runtime Error: 'RAISE_SHORTDUMP'. The OData request processing has been abnormally terminated. Analyze the runtime error using Feed Reader in ABAP development tools for Eclipse or using transaction /IWFND/ERROR_LOG or /IWBEP/ERROR_LOG or ST22. Create a support ticket on the application component of the OData service for errors in services delivered by SAP

How to get into /IWFND/ERROR_LOG or /IWBEP/ERROR_LOG or ST22 in BTP ABAP environment (free tier service plans) check the error.

Kindly help on this.

Dear Wolfgang,

We have already raised a support message with SAP regarding this issue. However, SAP responded that they do not provide support for the free-tier SAP BTP ABAP environment. They recommended posting the question in the SAP Community to seek assistance. Please find the response below

******************************
Info for Customer
Proposed Solution:
Dear customer,

you are running a free tier system. According to the free service plan "Only community support is available for free tier service plans, and these are not subject to SLAs."

Could you please check the documentation:

Landing page https://community.sap.com/topics/btp-abap-environment contains e.g.

Documentation https://help.sap.com/docs/BTP/65de2977205c403bbc107264b8eccf4b/2ffdd2412aff494dbf3de31089c965d4.html?locale=en-US

Learning Journey: https://help.sap.com/learning-journeys/49047e7668844d419ccee567923a475e

 

If you want to receive support you will have to update to a paid service plan first.

entry.title: How to access the SAP HANA Cloud database behind a BTP ABAP Environment instance?
entry.content:
Hi Community,

we are currently working with the SAP BTP ABAP Environment and would like to better understand the technical access to the SAP HANA Cloud instance that runs behind it. We are aware that the underlying SAP HANA Cloud instance is managed by the SAP ABAP Environment, but we are unsure about the supported ways to access it or extend it with custom database artifacts.

We have two related questions:

1. Direct access to the database
Is it possible to connect directly to the SAP HANA Cloud instance behind the BTP ABAP Environment — for example via Database Explorer or any external SQL tool — in order to create or inspect custom SQL views or procedures?
We already tried to create a SAP HANA Cloud project in SAP Business Application Studio, but the setup failed with the message that no database instance is available, even though we know the ABAP Environment uses a managed HANA Cloud instance in the background.
If such access is possible, where can we find or retrieve the database credentials / connection details?

2. Access pattern for SaaS scenarios
We are planning to build SaaS solutions on top of the BTP ABAP Environment.
In our CAP-based SaaS applications, we can retrieve tenant-specific database (hdi container) credentials via the Service Manager.
Is there a similar mechanism available in the BTP ABAP Environment to programmatically access or manage database connections (hdi containers) for different tenants?

If direct access is currently not possible, is it planned or on the SAP roadmap to allow connecting to the managed HANA Cloud instance in the future?

Any guidance, documentation, or personal experience around this would be very much appreciated!

Maybe @FrankJentsch can also share some insights here, since you have been very active around BTP ABAP Environment topics in the past.

Thanks & kind regards
Johannes

entry.title: I’m Not an ABAPer, But I Shipped an SAP OData Service with AI
entry.content:
🤖 I’m Not an ABAPer, But I Shipped an SAP OData Service with AI

Disclaimer & Anonymization
Examples are anonymized and simplified. Replace placeholders like <EQUIP_NO>, <EQUIP_NO_PADDED> (18-char with leading zeros), <FUNC_LOC>, <SHORT_TEXT>, <LONG_TEXT>. You’ll still need a bit of local effort to wire transports, authorizations, CSRF handling, and adjust BAPI structures in your own system.
 

When I first had to expose SAP Plant Maintenance notifications as an API, I wasn’t an ABAP developer. I live in the world of APIs, Node.js, and microservices — not in SE80 or BAPIs. Still, with a little help from AI, I built a working SAP OData service that creates and retrieves PM notifications using the classic BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_CREATE.

This post is my path from “what’s a BAPI?” to a fully functioning OData endpoint that anyone can call from Postman or a modern front-end app.

 

🧩 The Challenge

We needed an API to create maintenance notifications (equipment breakdowns, inspection reports, etc.) from an external system into SAP.

SAP does ship a standard service (/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_MAINTNOTIFICATION), but it wasn’t enough. We needed custom validations, long text handling, and our own response messages. So I decided to build a custom OData service:

/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZSERVICE_PM_NOTIFICATION_SRV

The only problem? I’m not an ABAPer.

 

🧠 Step 1: Let AI Draft the ABAP Skeleton

I asked ChatGPT (my ABAP copilot):

“Generate an OData service to create a Maintenance Notification with Equipment, FunctLoc, ShortText, and LongText.”

It gave me the SEGW model and even named the right BAPI (BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_CREATE). In SEGW, I created the project and an entity Notification like this:

Field Type Description

MaintenanceNotificationEdm.String(12) KeyNotification No
EquipmentEdm.String(18)Equipment No
FunctLocEdm.String(30)Functional Location
ShortTextEdm.String(40)Problem Description
LongTextEdm.String(1024)Additional Notes
MessageEdm.String(255)Response Message

Then I generated runtime artifacts → MPC, DPC, and DPC_EXT classes. So far, no manual code.

 

⚙️ Step 2: Let AI Build the CREATE_ENTITY Logic

The AI produced a clean version I pasted into
ZCL_ZPM_NOTIF_DPC_EXT → NOTIFICATIONSET_CREATE_ENTITY.

METHOD notificationset_create_entity.
  DATA: ls_in  TYPE zcl_zpm_notif_mpc=>ts_notif,
        ls_out TYPE zcl_zpm_notif_mpc=>ts_notif,
        ls_hdr TYPE bapi2080_nothdri,
        lt_return TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapiret2,
        ls_return TYPE bapiret2,
        lv_notif TYPE qmnum,
        lv_notif_c TYPE char12.

  " Read payload from POST JSON
  io_data_provider->read_entry_data( IMPORTING es_data = ls_in ).

  IF ls_in-shorttext IS INITIAL.
    RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception
      EXPORTING message = 'ShortText is required'.
  ENDIF.

  " Optional but recommended: pad equipment to 18 (ALPHA)
  IF ls_in-equipment IS NOT INITIAL.
    DATA(lv_equ) = ls_in-equipment.
    CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_ALPHA_INPUT'
      EXPORTING input  = lv_equ
      IMPORTING output = lv_equ.
    ls_hdr-equipment = lv_equ.
  ENDIF.

  " Map input to BAPI header
  ls_hdr-descript  = ls_in-shorttext.
  ls_hdr-funct_loc = ls_in-functloc.
  IF ls_hdr-equipment IS INITIAL.
    ls_hdr-equipment = ls_in-equipment.
  ENDIF.

  " Call BAPI to create the notification
  CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_CREATE'
    EXPORTING
      notif_type  = 'M1'
      notifheader = ls_hdr
    IMPORTING
      number      = lv_notif
    TABLES
      return      = lt_return.

  " Save and commit the notification
  CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_SAVE'
    EXPORTING number = lv_notif
    TABLES    return = lt_return.

  CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT'
    EXPORTING wait = abap_true.

  " Format notification number
  lv_notif_c = |{ lv_notif ALPHA = OUT }|.

  " Prepare OData response
  ls_out-maintenancenotification = lv_notif_c.
  ls_out-equipment               = ls_in-equipment.
  ls_out-functloc                = ls_in-functloc.
  ls_out-shorttext               = ls_in-shorttext.
  ls_out-longtext                = ls_in-longtext.
  ls_out-message                 = |Created notification { lv_notif_c }|.

  er_entity = ls_out.
ENDMETHOD.

Even though AI wrote the ABAP, I learned:

  • io_data_provider maps JSON → ABAP structure.
  • er_entity sends back the OData response.
  • BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_CREATE creates the record; BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_SAVE + COMMIT persists it.
  • Tip: Equipment often requires leading zeros (ALPHA) or you’ll hit “Equipment not found”.
 

🔍 Step 3: Testing the OData Endpoint

In /IWFND/GW_CLIENT, I ran:

POST /sap/opu/odata/sap/ZSERVICE_PM_NOTIFICATION_SRV/NotificationSet
Payload
{
  "Equipment": "<EQUIP_NO>",
  "FunctLoc": "<FUNC_LOC>",
  "ShortText": "<SHORT_TEXT>",
  "LongText": "<LONG_TEXT>"
}
Response
{
  "d": {
    "MaintenanceNotification": "100012345678",
    "Equipment": "<EQUIP_NO>",
    "FunctLoc": "<FUNC_LOC>",
    "ShortText": "<SHORT_TEXT>",
    "Message": "Created notification 100012345678"
  }
}

That was the moment — the notification number finally showed up 🎉.

 

🧩 Step 4: Add a “View All Notifications” Endpoint

To list notifications, AI suggested BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_GETLIST. Minimal example:

METHOD notificationset_get_entityset.
  DATA: lt_notif TYPE TABLE OF bapi2080_notif_list,
        ls_notif TYPE bapi2080_notif_list.

  CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_GETLIST'
    EXPORTING  notif_type = 'M1'
    TABLES     notiflist  = lt_notif.

  LOOP AT lt_notif INTO ls_notif.
    APPEND VALUE zcl_zpm_notif_mpc=>ts_notif(
      maintenancenotification = ls_notif-notif_no
      shorttext               = ls_notif-descript
      functloc                = ls_notif-funct_loc
      equipment               = ls_notif-equipment
    ) TO et_entityset.
  ENDLOOP.
ENDMETHOD.

Now I can hit:

GET /sap/opu/odata/sap/ZSERVICE_PM_NOTIFICATION_SRV/NotificationSet

…and get a clean JSON list of maintenance notifications.

 

🪲 Step 5: Debugging (with Help from AI)

When the notification number didn’t return, AI helped me debug like this:

  • Set External Breakpoints in ZCL_ZPM_NOTIF_DPC_EXT.
  • Use /IWFND/GW_CLIENT → POST again to hit the breakpoint.
  • Watch: ls_hdr-descript, ls_hdr-equipment, lv_notif, ls_out-maintenancenotification.
  • If it doesn’t stop, check:
    • /IWBEP/ERROR_LOG (Gateway errors)
    • /IWFND/TRACES (payload/trace)
    • ST22 (ABAP dumps)

Common fixes

  • Equipment padding: CONVERSION_EXIT_ALPHA_INPUT before calling the BAPI.
  • Wrong notif type: switch between M1/M2 as per your config.
  • CSRF: fetch token first; then POST with token + JSON.
  • Authorizations: ensure users can create that notification type/plant.
 

🧠 Lessons Learned (as a Non-ABAP Developer)

Lesson Explanation

BAPI ≈ SAP’s internal APIThink of BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_CREATE as a function that writes a record.
ALPHA = OUTFormats numbers with leading zeros for display (e.g., 1234 → 000000001234).
DPC_EXTWhere you write logic; like a controller in Node.js.
er_entity = ls_outYour OData response back to the caller.
/IWFND/GW_CLIENTSAP’s built-in Postman!
 

🧩 Step 6 (Optional): Long Text

If your payload has long descriptions, add a helper:

IF ls_in-longtext IS NOT INITIAL.
  me->add_qmel_longtext(
    iv_notifno = lv_notif_c,
    iv_longtxt = CONV string( ls_in-longtext )
  ).
ENDIF.

This will save long text into SAP’s long-text tab automatically (implement your helper with SAVE_TEXT).

 

🆘 Troubleshooting prompt (copy & paste into AI)

Use this when something fails. Replace placeholders with your values.

Prompt:
You are an SAP Gateway & PM ABAP/OData debugger. I have an OData service that creates PM Notifications. Analyze and give exact fix steps with code diffs.

Context
- System/SID/Client: <SID>/<CLIENT>
- Endpoint: <HOST>/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZSERVICE_PM_NOTIFICATION_SRV/NotificationSet (or V4 path)
- Action: POST create notification
- Error (verbatim): "<ERROR_TEXT>"
- /IWBEP/ERROR_LOG ID: <LOG_ID> (stack excerpt below)
- Payload JSON: { "Equipment": "<EQUIP_NO>", "FunctLoc": "<FUNC_LOC>", "ShortText": "<SHORT_TEXT>", "LongText": "<LONG_TEXT>" }
- Code snippet(s): DPC_EXT create_entity + NOTIFICATIONSET_CREATE_ENTITY
- BAPI flow: BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_CREATE → BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_SAVE → BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT

Please verify
1) Equipment padding (ALPHA to 18 chars) and existence in EQUI/EQKT; try <EQUIP_NO_PADDED>.
2) Correct notif_type (M1/M2) and header mapping (funct_loc, equipment, short_text).
3) CSRF token and Content-Type; provide exact curl/Postman sequence if wrong.
4) Authorization/object checks for plant and notification type.
5) Number ranges if equipment creation fails (SNRO: EQUIP_NR, OIEN assignment).
6) Gateway exception mapping to /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception messages.
7) If RAP/CDS path is used, handler create logic and service binding.

Artifacts
- ERROR_LOG excerpt: <PASTE_LOG>
- Code snippet: <PASTE_DPC_EXT_METHOD>

Deliver a concise fix with the exact ABAP line(s)/payload to change.
 

🎯 The Final Result

  • A custom OData service ZSERVICE_PM_NOTIFICATION_SRV
  • A POST endpoint to create notifications
  • A GET endpoint to view them
  • AI-generated ABAP that actually worked
  • And a newfound respect for the SAP Gateway debugger 😅
 

🔮 Takeaway

You don’t have to be an ABAP veteran to build SAP OData services. With AI assistance, patience, and a few SAP debugging tools, even integration engineers can craft end-to-end APIs that interact directly with the core system.

Author: Sayantan Tarafdar
Title: How I Used AI to Build an SAP PM Notification OData API (as a Non-ABAP Developer)
Tags: #SAPBTP #OData #BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_CREATE #PlantMaintenance #Integration #ABAPForNonABAPers

entry.title: BAdI Sorter in SAP BTP ABAP for custom BAdI Definition
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Recently we've been developing solutions in SAP BTP ABAP environment, and we would like to create some custom Business Add-in (BAdI) and hook its BAdI definition inside our code for customer extension.

It looks good so far, until we came with a question, how to define the sequence for these BAdIs implementation?

In On-Premise world, we used the good old BADI_SORTER but seems like it isn't permitted to use in BTP ABAP environment. Even if it's allowed, I think it is still using the classic elements like dynpro screen, function modules, ... which isn't following the modern strategy from SAP when developing in cloud environment like BTP ABAP.

I've been exploring a bit on the Internet as well as SAP published documentations for SAP BTP ABAP. Unfortunately, I couldn't find any other options to enable sorting of custom BAdI implementations.

Does anyone have any ideas, how to control the sequence of BAdIs in BTP ABAP?

Thank you very much.

Best Regards,

Tan

entry.title: Parameter has invalid value: Parameter IV_VALUE has invalid value .
entry.content:
Hi All,

Below is my oData URL and when executing from /IWFND/GW_CLIENT

/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_project_v3/srvd_a2x/sap/project/0001/WBSElement?sap-statistics=true&$top=2

I am getting the below response:
{
"error" : {
"code" : "CX_PARAMETER_INVALID_RANGE",
"message" : "Parameter has invalid value: Parameter IV_VALUE has invalid value .",
"@SAP__common.ExceptionCategory" : "Client_Error",
"details" : [
{
"code" : "/IWCOR/CX_OD_INTERNAL_ERROR/0050569259751EE4BA97133877F61116",
"message" : "In the context of Data Services an unknown internal server error occurred",
"@SAP__common.Severity" : "error",
"@SAP__common.numericSeverity" : 4
},
{
"code" : "/IWCOR/CX_OD_EP_ENTITY_ERROR/0050569259751EE4BA9739C53C899155",
"message" : "Error occurred while processing property 'SchedldBasicEarliestStartDate' of entity with index 1",
"@SAP__common.Severity" : "error",
"@SAP__common.numericSeverity" : 4
},
{
"code" : "/IWCOR/CX_OD_EP_PROPERTY_ERROR/005056A509B11ED1BF822D2D09173A04",
"message" : "Property 'SchedldBasicEarliestStartDate' has invalid value ''",
"@SAP__common.Severity" : "error",
"@SAP__common.numericSeverity" : 4
}
],
"innererror" : {
"ErrorDetails" : {
"@SAP__common.Application" : {
"ComponentId" : "PS-ST",
"ServiceRepository" : "SRVD_A2X",
"ServiceId" : "API_PROJECT_V3",
"ServiceVersion" : "0001"
},
"@SAP__common.TransactionId" : "A2E9BF5D760A0070E0068F0DD38A7ACB",
"@SAP__common.Timestamp" : "20251016161510.514754",
"@SAP__common.ErrorResolution" : {
"Analysis" : "Use ADT feed reader \"SAP Gateway Error Log\" or run transaction /IWFND/ERROR_LOG on SAP Gateway hub system and search for entries with the timestamp above for more details",
"Note" : "See SAP Note 1797736 for error analysis (https://service.sap.com/sap/support/notes/1797736)"
}
}
}
}
}

Did anyone faced this error and please let me know how to resolve this error?

Thanks,

BK
